Mild: Regular eye checkups every 6 months. Maintain good blood sugar control. Follow a healthy diet rich in antioxidants.
Moderate: More frequent eye examinations (every 3-4 months). Consider laser treatment if recommended by your doctor. Strict blood sugar management.
Severe: Immediate consultation with a retina specialist. Likely need laser treatment or other interventions. Strict blood sugar and blood pressure control.
Proliferative DR: Urgent medical attention required. May need vitrectomy surgery or anti-VEGF injections. Regular monitoring and strict control of diabetes.
